fact: 2048 is a popular single-player game for Web and mobile. It's an innovative type of "sliding block puzzle" game
author: Caitlin Dewey

fact: The game was developed by 19 year old Gabriele Cirulli.
author: Salvador Rodriguez

fact: Cirulli says that his entry into the game industry is accidental and he doesn't intend to make any other games.'
author: Peter Spence

fact: 2048 was an exercise by the creator to see if he could create a game from scratch, it is based on an older game that he say on forums called "1024"
author: Salvador Rodriguez

fact: The game was downloaded more than 4 million times during its first week. It was hosted on Github which handled the traffic well, the servers would've crashed were it hosted anywhere else.'
author: Peter Spence

fact: Most of the downloads of the game came from Anglosaxon countries, but China accounted for the second highest number of downloads.
author: Peter Spence

fact: 2048's blowout success is similar to another game called Flappy Bird, which was also developed over one weekend and have gone on to be downloaded millions of times.
author: Arjun Kharpal

fact: Despite the success of the game, Cirulli has only received "A few hundred bucks" from donations by players of the game, he has no intention of profitting from the game or advertising it, saying he is extremely satisfied with the success.
author: Arjun Kharpal

fact: After the first week, globally, the game has been estimated to have been played for more than 500 years. Cirulli arrived at this conclusion by estimating that the time most people play the game might be 8 minutes.
author: Hillary Reinsberg

fact: A "Doge" meme version of the game was created in 7 days.
author: Hillary Reinsberg
